file_content.text: Approaching Drelliad village, sir. Scopes show small-arms fire and enemy movements in all quarters. Separatists are definitely moving on the objective.
Code red! Code red! We've been hit by an AP missile! A shoulder-launcher from somewhere in the village! Everyone hold on--
You're not supposed to be here, kid.
There's work to be done, kid. Time for talk later.
You'd better get up to Fort Garnik, kid. Be careful out there.
Nice work, kid! You've got a talent--there's no denying that.
I, however, didn't have much success. This walker isn't gonna be moving anytime soon.
Don't beat yourself up. If it was possible, you'd have fixed it.
I'm sure you did your best.
Thanks, kid. Shame about the driver, though. Poor guy never had a chance.
What a waste of time. Just requisition a new one.
Who cares?
Are you kidding? With our budget, we'll be lucky if Command even sends us a dewback to replace the thing.
What now, sir?
I'm gonna stay here and salvage all the goodies off this wreck before someone else does. You better head for Fort Garnik.
Be sure to keep a lookout for seps on your way to the fort--they can come at you out of nowhere.
I'll keep my eyes open.
I noticed that.
Sure you don't want me to stick around and cover you while you work?
Will you be okay on your own?
No, no, I'll--I'll be fine. Hey, I'm not exactly new to this, kid.
Without anyone else to slow me down, I'll be fine.
I can handle myself.
You know, you'd probably move even faster if you dropped some of that attitude, kid.
Stay sharp out there. I'll see you later.
I'll do my best with this walker, kid, but you need to disable those missile launchers in the village before they take anyone else out.
Ah, there's not a feeling in this galaxy like riding a hundred-tonne walker right through the middle of a combat zone, huh, kid?
Another beautiful day on Ord Mantell! You excited, kid? Nervous? You know, you're the first new entry to Havoc Squad in some time.
I'll fight the enemies of the Republic with everything I've got, sir.
I'm ready to do my part.
No need to call me "sir." We're in the field--you can lose the formality.
What made Havoc choose to bring me in?
Why recruit a new member?
There's just too much happening on Ord Mantell. Guys in charge decided we need an extra pair of hands.
I've got nothing to be nervous about--fighting is my life.
I was born for this.
Confidence! I like it! Getting tapped for Havoc Squad at your age is nothing to sneeze at.
I'm Lieutenant Bex Kolos, but everyone in Havoc calls me Gearbox. We're a tight unit--you'll like it with us.
I'm looking forward to serving with the best soldiers in the Republic, sir.
It's an honor to join you.
And we're glad to have you, kid. Believe me.
As long as all of you can keep up with me, we should be fine.
We'll see.
Hah! That won't be a problem, kid. Don't worry.
Let me tell you why we're here: The separatists have nabbed a Republic bomb off of a downed transport--a serious bomb, one of those orbital strike numbers.
Why are we on Ord Mantell?
Havoc's here to find a stolen Republic bomb, one of those nasty orbital strike numbers. Apparently, a transport crashed with the bomb onboard, and the separatists got there first.
There's no telling where these grimy bushwhackers have hidden the thing. They have popular support and hideouts everywhere. Finding this bomb won't be easy.
No mission is too tough for Havoc Squad!
We can handle this!
Hope you're right, kid. That bomb goes off and the whole island's one big crater.
Doesn't sound hard to me.
Take it from me, kid: On an op like this, you don't sleep much.
What are the weapon specs?
Tell me about the bomb.
The bomb is designed to slag a huge city, so it could wipe this little island right off the map.
You'll get a full op brief once we reach Fort Garnik. For now, just sit back and--
Driver! Driver? Blast it, he's down. Backwater separatists aren't supposed to have armor-piercing missiles! They'll tear up every convoy that passes through here!
How should we proceed, sir?
What should we do?
Major hardware in enemy hands--seems like the kind of thing we should've been warned about.
How could intel miss this?
Let's get out of this alive and worry about filing complaints later, all right?
If the separatists want trouble, let's give them some.
So let's take these seps out!
Sounds good to me, kid.
We've got to get this walker moving again, and we've got to disable the seps' AP missiles--and we need them both done yesterday.
Fixing things is my specialty, kid--I'm nowhere near the fighter you are. I'll stay and get this walker moving again. You'll disable the separatists' missile launchers. Understood?
Got it.
We were hit pretty hard. What are the odds of getting this thing moving again?
Can you really fix the damage?
Not sure, honestly. But it takes months to requisition a new one.
Could I ask why I'm doing all the fighting in this plan, sir?
You've got to be joking.
I've already paid my dues, kid. Now, there's missile launchers in that village to deactivate.
The separatists will probably have their missile launchers piled together in a cache somewhere in the village--and you can bet that cache will be heavily guarded.
Find the cache, disable the missile launchers, and then double-time it back here. Got it, Sergeant?
Yes, sir.
I hope the seps brought plenty of body bags--they're gonna need them.
Time to rack up some kills.
Good luck out there, kid.
I'm not the one you should worry about, sir.
Worry about yourself.
Whatever you say, kid. Now get out there!
I haven't got time to talk, kid.
Don't bother me.
